fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27498].
  {panel}

In the sysadmin team, we're having discussions about ways we can use JIRA to track our regular work better.

Currently, a lot of our work is triggered by emails that spam the entire team - for instance, Nagios alerts and updates to Noctane issues from Contegix both go to the entire team.

This isn't a scalable way of tracking work; everybody assumes that someone else will respond to email; even if someone does respond, there's often no way for the rest of the team to know if someone has already looked at an email or not (we can usually tell if someone has decided to respond, but if someone has looked and decided no response is required, we can't tell that).

Remote Links would be very useful (I think) in helping us to adapt JIRA to better track our work. Every Nagios alert has a url; every Noctane issue has a URL. If we had a bot that could create a JIRA issue and link it back to the remote url, this would be a start. However, we want to make sure that updates to the noctane issue/nagios alert get added to the same issue.

The cleanest way I can think of managing this would be if we can use JQL to search for "issues that link to this remote url"; but that's not currently possible.

The second-cleanest way I can think of managing this is to put the url (or some unique subset of it, like the Noctane issue number) in a custom field. However, the requirement that this field would have to be displayed on the issue type's issue-create screen means that this custom field would get flashed in front of humans all the time. My experience with doing this is that users get confused by this and start asking "Why do I have to fill in this field?", so I'd prefer to avoid having to do that if at all possible.
fields.summary: JQL search for issues that link to a remote URL

fields.description:
I try to adapt the JIM to some special needs of our company and now I’m facing some difficulties with the getSingularObjectFromString from the SelectCFType.
 
In our old environment (4.0.2) it was no problem to give a string representing the value of a select list like “Bananas” from a fruit list. But if I try now in 4.4.5 to get the object for “Bananas” I only get null. 
So I checked the behavior of the SelectCFType Class and saw that nowadays the string given by the System is a number which is representing the value like “12345” for “Bananas”. 

So my question is get I some thing wrong and there is still a way to get an Object from a string or is this a issue with JIRA 4.4.*.

BR
Ludwig

*Connection topology:*
JIRA(Embedded Crowd) using Atlassian Crowd directory --> Crowd(Using Delegated Authentication Directory) --> LDAP(AD)


*Steps to replicate:*
# Configure JIRA to Crowd without using SSO
# Create a new user in LDAP server
# Configure Crowd to use Delegated Authentication Directory to connect with LDAP
# Configure the Crowd directory Default Group Memberships to have jira-users
# Login in to JIRA with the user
# User probably able to login to JIRA
# Delete the user from JIRA
# Shut down JIRA
# Change the seraph-config.xml to use the following authenticator:
{code}
<authenticator class="com.atlassian.jira.security.login.SSOSeraphAuthenticator"/>
{code}
# Start JIRA and try to login with the LDAP user again  

This scenario only happen when using the SSO class in seraph-config.xml to enable SSO:
{code}
<authenticator class="com.atlassian.jira.security.login.SSOSeraphAuthenticator"/>
{code}

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+Options#ConfiguringJIRAOptions-Options contains some detail on how to turn the form on.  It does not, however, go into any detail on who will be the recipients of a submitted form.

Discussions with a developer indicate that the recipients are hard coded to be those with 'Administrator' permission on the instance and not those with 'SysAdmin' privileges.

I have raised https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-27454 as a feature request to allow configuration of the recipients of the Contact Administrator Form, so this will change the documentation required if it goes through.

I also think that http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA043/How+to+Edit+the+'Contact+Administrator'+Page+in+JIRA+4.1.1+and+Above may not be current, I have heard that this may have changed in JIRA 4.4

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27451].
  {panel}

One useful feature would be to display more information next to conditions, validators and post-functions to indicate from inside the workflow which plugin provides this feature.

This would help Atlassian Support debug problems that refer to:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Cannot+Create+Issues+due+to+%27Could+not+load+validator%27+class+Errors

It would also help JIRA administrators work out which plugin is providing a workflow extension that is causing problems. The current process involves taking the text displayed for a condition etc and then searching source code of every likely looking installed plugin. That's very inefficient.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27449].
  {panel}

When using an external user directory for password or user management such as Active Directory, it would be good if we could associate a single user with multiple user directories.

Reason: because in most environments there are multiple directory servers for redundancy.  In some places the servers are not as stable as others so one might go down.  

If we could group them together in Jira so that if it sees the same account(user/group) in both directories in the same directory group it recognizes them as the same account.  This would allow external user/password management to continue uninterrupted if one of the directories is not longer accessible.

In our particular case, we are unable to take advantage of the external user/password management features because several times a week at least one of our Domain Controllers goes down - I don't manage them:(.  Jira doesn't recognize one account as being the same in different directories.

So I would like to see the ability to create User Directory groups.  Accounts with the same name in each directory within the same directory group will be viewed by Jira as the same user account or user group.

Does this sound Feasible?  Most companies do not put Active Directory behind a load balancer so this feature would be helpful.

Thanks
fields.summary: Associate a single user account with multiple User Directories

Hi all,

This customer has a problem that when he tries to edit an issue where a lot of users have assignable issues permission then it takes approx 2-3 minutes before edit screen opens in Internet Explorer 8.

The problem does not occur in any other browser except IE8 (not even in any other version of IE).

* No error in the logs.
* Problem started after upgrade to Jira 4.4.4
* It occurs only in one project where Assignable permission has whole company (for example 13000 users). In other projects where assignable permission has 100-200 users we don't have this problem.

Suggestion for improvement for section at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS#RunningJIRAoverSSLorHTTPS-GenerateSelf-SignedCertificate
----
(!) When running the following keytool command you will be prompted with:
{noformat}
What is your first and last name?
{noformat}

Instead of entering your first and last name as specified, you must enter the fully qualified hostname of the server running JIRA.
----
The "Instead of entering your first and last name as specified, you must enter the fully qualified hostname of the server running JIRA" should be bold or use note icon (i)

For example, should look like:
*Instead of entering your first and last name as specified, you must enter the fully qualified hostname of the server running JIRA* 

or 

(i) Instead of entering your first and last name as specified, you must enter the fully qualified hostname of the server running JIRA

h3. Summary

If the plugin system gets an exception while trying to delete the Felix OSGI cache, JIRA gets locked and is unusable:

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Stop it.

h3. Workaround

Our [JIRA Does Not Start Due to 'Unable to clean the cache directory'|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-does-not-start-due-to-unable-to-clean-the-cache-directory-223219163.html] KB instructs how to fix this.
fields.summary: JIRA fails to start if it can't delete the Felix OSGI cache

fields.description:
I'm basically creating a new ticket for this JRA:
JRA-24174

I believe the description was confusing, which lead us to believe that the problem was manually editing the database.  In reality, this is a problem with deleting directories in JIRA's interface.

Steps to reproduce:
* Create a new LDAP directory in JIRA (delegated or not, reproducible in both)
* Synchronise this directory
* Verify that users/groups/memberships have been added to JIRA
* Check the database cwd_directory table.  Notice the new directory and it's ID
* Back in JIRA's interface, disable/remove the new directory
* Now query the database again
* Notice that there is still data in cwd_user, cwd_user_attributes,cwd_group, cwd_membership referencing the deleted directory.

This causes no functionality loss within JIRA, but it will definitely clutter up the database.  This is leaves invalid entries, making it harder to troubleshoot.  This is especially a problem for admins testing new directory setups and have thousands of users.

On top of that, there really needs to be added are Foreign Key constraints to the tables.

For example, on the Confluence side there is this constraint:
{code}TABLE "cwd_user" CONSTRAINT "fk_user_dir_id" FOREIGN KEY (directory_id) REFERENCES cwd_directory(id){code}
fields.summary: Deleting a Directory does not Delete User/Group Information Relating to the Removed Directory

fields.description:
There are several behaviours with the in-comment mentions that would appear to be bugs:

# Allows any user to mention by entering manual WML [~<username>] when the user does not have the appropriate permissions (e.g.: browse projects, browse users). However, It does not bring up the search box if using @username if that user doesn't have permissions.
#* Please see {{Error1}} and {{Error1_Preview}}. User "testnull" is not a member of any groups.
# Certain cases of mention syntaxs do not work as expected:
*works:*
{noformat}
[~dcurrie@atlassian.com]
{noformat}
[~dcurrie@atlassian.com]
*does not work:*
[@dcurrie@atlassian.com]
[~@dcurrie@atlassian.com]
[@~dcurrie@atlassian.com]
# When mouse clicking on a user, as in {{Error3a}}, the _Found no matching users_ prompt will appear, as in {{Error3b}}. This does not appear if you use the keyboard. To recreate:
## Open comment.
## Mention @<user>.
## Mouse click on the user.
## Press space and the prompt appears.
# A user without required permissions can mention a user with required permissions and it will notify them. For example:
#* Testuser is in jira-users.
#* Testdeveloper is in jira-developers.
#* Browse Users for the project is jira-developers.
#* Testuser mentions testdeveloper using [~testdeveloper].
#* Testdeveloper receives notification.
# Using the above example permissions, when Browse Users is set to jira-developers and I am logged in as a User without that group, I can still click the hyperlink for the mentioned user.
fields.summary: In-comment mentions errors
Create issue on transition

fields.description:
Hi All,

I have specific problem: a status was added to a workflow which is used by more than 15 workflow scheme. The problem is that this status is unwanted. It would be no problem as for me because it's an orphan status, so users can't see but our JIRA admin leader said this status has to be removed from the workflow. Because this workflow is used by more than 15 workflow schemes and these WF schemes are involved up to 40 projects - you know already - it would be an enormous effort to change the WF, WF scheme...
Is there any jelly script for removing this step? This status is not used by any project.

Thanks in advance,
Rumi
fields.summary: Remove status from workflow
Improve logging for NoClassDefFound and NoSuchMethodErrors during plugin loading
Consolidate and Optimise Outbound mail
Tooltips for workflow actions
Mentions should automatically add a mentioned user as a watcher to the issue.

fields.description:
JIRA is configured correctly to LDAP. However, if:
* network issue
* LDAP is currently not reachable

JIRA will throw message that indicating that the user is giving wrong credential. This might create panic for end users and thus, better message should be given at this scenario.
fields.summary: More user friendly error message when unable to authenticate via LDAP
Move CapturingRequestWrapper from jira-core to jira-api

fields.description:
1 Create a customer field "Text Field (< 255 characters)"
2 Integrate it into a screen
3 Call this screen, type some text into field and send form
4 Call this screen again in another issue

Now there is no autocomplete or field history shown.
This works for different fields, e.g. Quicksearch.

I'm not sure whether this is a Chrome or JIRA issue, but I believe it may depend on field attributed and therefore may be a JIRA problem.
fields.summary: Autocomplete/history not working for some fields in Chrome

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27424].
  {panel}

Originally raised in https://support.atlassian.com/

{quote}The system should at least generate a warning in the integrity control check and/or during administration of (Issues/Fields/Custom fields) 
and (Issues/Screens/Issue Type Screen Scheme) if :

the custom field is attached to the "available context issue type" and located in the "specific screen" (Issues/Fields/Custom fields)
or the custom field id attached to the "specific screen" (Issues/Screens/Configure)
and ANOTHER Issue Type configured in Issue Type Screen Scheme for the "specific scree"n is not containing the expected custom fields from the "available context issue type" (Issues/Screens/Issue Type Screen Scheme)
As a result, some fields are not rendered in the "specific screen" because no data exists in the project context.

Administrator should also have access to contextual information during Issue browsing to know the current screen / screen scheme ... / fields ...
/ workflow ... / active rules decision plan to easily identify where the configuration issue is located.{quote}
fields.summary: Administrating Fields/IssueType/Screens vs IssueType/Screens should trigger an integrity check of the changes made
InstrumentationConfiguration.isCPUPostCollected calls IsDevMode a lot  -this is a blocking call

fields.description: We are not setting maxIdle in the server.xml for the standalone environment - this means the connection pool defaults to 8 maximum idle connections, and it nearly always results in closed connections being removed from the pool.  Experimentation has confirmed that setting it to -1 gives better pooling performance.
fields.summary: Standalone does not have sensible defaults for the connection pool

When clicking Issue Navigator > Views > On Dashboard menu, the Gadgets popup window doesn't display the left navigation properly.
It displays the same in browsers IE8, Chrome, Firefox 3.6
fields.summary: Gadgets popup window doesn't display the left navigation properly

fields.description:
{{com.atlassian.jira.security.login.SSOSeraphAuthenticator.logoutUser()}} calls {{request.getSession()}} to remove an attribute from the session. However, {{request.getSession()}} creates a session if none is attached to the request. This results in sessions being created unnecessarily. A better approach would be to use {{request.getSession(false)}} and return if there is no session.

The impact is described in [JSTDEV-1485|https://sdog.jira.com/browse/JSTDEV-1485]. I'm marking this as minor because there are general workarounds afoot (JRA-27406 to rapidly expire one-request sessions, and CWD-2784 to avoid calling logout on the concrete Authenticator if there is no session). However, it would be worth fixing the root cause.
fields.summary: SSOSeraphAuthenticator unnecessarily creates sessions on logout

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27397].
  {panel}

There is some leakage of temporary attachments (that have already been uploaded but not yet included in an issue) from one browser tab to another.

Steps to reproduce:
* open two tabs
* in both tabs click the "Create Issue" button
* in tab 1: click "choose file" and add an attachment
* in tab 2: click the "configure fields" and switch the mode from all to custom, or vice-versa. the attachment that was uploaded in tab 1 now shows up in tab 2 (!)

We can easily end up in a situation where we upload attachments to the wrong issue, which is pretty bad (think security levels, permissions, etc). I suspect editing issues will suffer from the same problem.
fields.summary: Temporary attachments leak into other "Create issue" dialogs

fields.description:
When gadgets' configuration is saved, then it is first validated.If that passes then sent to generate method.
If multiselect is used, then validate method gets List<String> of selected items. But generate method gets just String that contains all values, separated by | (pipe) symbol.
In case no items are selected, validate method gets *null* as argument, but _generate method gets previously saved value_ instead of null or empty string.
This behavior renders usage of validate useless for some cases.
fields.summary: Cannot unselect gadget configuration options. Validate and generate method see parameters differently.

fields.description:
Hi 


We have an OnDemand instance, and since JIRA5 upgrade we have an issue - user assignment field is no working correctly (e.g. main field in the user assignment dialog box). Basically, in JIRA5 it slightly changed it's behaviour, and now, when we try to type something in the field - it's not coming up with suggestions as it should. Looks like a JS problem, but the strange thing here is that this problem persists on several machines, while working fine on other machines under very similar conditions. 

Sure cookies and cache clearing doesn't help. It's reproduced at least on 3 PCs in our company and is quite annoying. 

There is a workaround, is you type in the login of required user - it works fine, but really this is not what we want it to be.

I've looked around but couldn't find this issue already posted. If there is one - please lead me to it.
fields.summary: user selection field not working correctly

fields.description: If an issue is accessed via the direct url an error message discloses if the issue is existent or not - even when the use isn't logged-in.
